activities.title: Python Variables & Data Types
activities.description: Learn the basics of Python variables and data types with interactive examples.

steps.title: Creating Variables
steps.explanation: In Python, you can create variables by simply assigning values to names.
steps.hint: Try changing the values and see what happens!

steps.title: Data Types
steps.explanation: Python has several built-in data types: strings, integers, floats, and booleans.
steps.hint: Use the type() function to check any variable's type!

activities.title: Python Built-in Functions Matching
activities.description: Match Python built-in functions with their correct outputs and learn their usage.

pairs.explanation: len() returns the length of a string

activities.title: Master Python For Loops
activities.description: Complete the missing parts in Python for loops to master iteration.

content.code:
# Loop through a list of numbers
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
___ num ___ numbers:
    print(f'Number: {num}')

# Loop with range
___ i ___ range(___,___):
    print(f'Count: {i}')

# Loop through a string
word = 'Python'
___ char ___ ___:
    print(f'Letter: {char}')

blanks.hint: The variable name for the string

content.explanation: For loops are used to iterate over sequences like lists, strings, and ranges.

activities.title: Python If-Else Statements
activities.description: Learn Python conditional logic with if-else statements and practice decision making.

steps.title: Basic If Statement
steps.explanation: Use if statements to execute code based on conditions.

steps.title: If-Else Statement
steps.explanation: Add an else clause for alternative actions.

steps.title: If-Elif-Else Chain

activities.title: String Methods Explorer
activities.description: Explore Python string methods and see how they transform text data.

explorations.explanation: Splits string into a list of words

activities.title: Python Code Structure Builder
activities.description: Drag and drop Python code blocks to build a complete program structure.

content.target: Build a program that calculates the average of three numbers
hints: Start with comments to document your code
Display the result at the end

activities.title: Dictionary Memory Challenge
activities.description: Test your memory of Python dictionary operations and key-value relationships.

cards.back: Gets value safely with default None
Removes and returns value for key

content.rules: Match dictionary methods with their descriptions. Find all pairs to complete the challenge!

activities.title: Tuple vs List Quiz
activities.description: Test your understanding of the differences between tuples and lists in Python.

questions.question: Which data structure is immutable in Python?
questions.explanation: Tuples are immutable, meaning their elements cannot be changed after creation.

questions.question: What happens when you try to change a tuple element?
questions.explanation: Attempting to modify a tuple raises a TypeError because tuples are immutable.

questions.question: Which is faster for accessing elements?
questions.explanation: Tuples are slightly faster for element access due to their immutable nature.

questions.question: How do you create a tuple with one element?
questions.explanation: A comma is required to create a single-element tuple: (5,)

activities.title: Set Operations Visualizer
activities.description: Visualize and understand Python set operations through interactive demonstrations.

visualizations.explanation: Union combines all unique elements from both sets
Intersection returns elements common to both sets
Difference returns elements in first set but not in second

activities.title: Binary Search Algorithm
activities.description: Understand how binary search works through step-by-step visualization.

steps.decision: Target is smaller, search left half
Target is larger, search right half
Target is larger, search right half

activities.title: Sorting Algorithms Comparison
activities.description: Compare different sorting algorithms and understand their performance characteristics.

algorithms.name: Bubble Sort
algorithms.description: Repeatedly steps through the list, compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order.

algorithms.name: Quick Sort
algorithms.description: Divides the array into smaller sub-arrays around a pivot element.

algorithms.name: Merge Sort
algorithms.description: Divides the array into halves, sorts them, and then merges them back together.

activities.title: Graph Traversal Builder
activities.description: Build graph traversal algorithms step by step and understand DFS vs BFS.

content.description: Build both Depth-First Search (DFS) and Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithms

modules.name: Graph Representation
modules.explanation: First, create a graph data structure using adjacency lists

modules.name: DFS Implementation
modules.explanation: Depth-First Search uses recursion to go as deep as possible

modules.name: BFS Implementation
modules.explanation: Breadth-First Search uses a queue to visit all neighbors first

activities.title: Function Fundamentals Lab
activities.description: Master Python functions through progressive coding exercises.

exercises.title: Basic Function Creation
exercises.instruction: Create a function that calculates the area of a rectangle
exercises.solution:
def calculate_area(length, width):
    return length * width

exercises.title: Default Parameters
exercises.instruction: Create a function with default parameters for greeting

activities.title: Class Design Workshop
activities.description: Learn object-oriented programming by designing and building Python classes.

content.description: Build a complete Student class with attributes and methods

components.name: Class Definition
components.explanation: Define the Student class with constructor and attributes

components.name: Add Methods
components.explanation: Add methods to manipulate and calculate student data

components.name: String Representation
components.explanation: Implement string representations for better object display

activities.title: OOP Inheritance Challenge
activities.description: Master inheritance concepts by building a class hierarchy system.

content.explanation: Inheritance allows classes to inherit attributes and methods from parent classes.

activities.title: Decorators Deep Dive
activities.description: Understand Python decorators through interactive examples and practical applications.

steps.title: Basic Decorator Concept
steps.explanation: Decorators are functions that modify or enhance other functions.
steps.hint: The @ symbol is syntactic sugar for decoration

steps.title: Decorator with Arguments
steps.explanation: Decorators can accept arguments and work with any function.
steps.hint: Use *args and **kwargs to handle any function signature

steps.title: Real-World Example: Caching
steps.explanation: Decorators are useful for caching expensive function calls.
steps.hint: Memoization dramatically improves recursive function performance

activities.title: Exception Handling Quiz
activities.description: Test your knowledge of Python exception handling and error management.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for handling multiple exceptions?
questions.explanation: Multiple exceptions are handled using a tuple: except (ValueError, TypeError):

questions.question: What does the 'finally' block do?
options: Runs only when an exception occurs
Runs only when no exception occurs
Runs regardless of whether an exception occurs
questions.explanation: The finally block always executes, whether an exception occurs or not.

questions.question: How do you raise a custom exception?
questions.explanation: Use the 'raise' keyword to throw exceptions in Python.

questions.question: What happens when an exception is not handled?
options: The program terminates with an error
questions.explanation: Unhandled exceptions cause the program to terminate and display a traceback.

activities.title: Python Basics Memory Game
activities.description: Match Python concepts with their definitions in this comprehensive memory challenge.

cards.back: A named storage location that holds data
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task
A control structure that repeats code execution
A statement that executes code based on a condition
An ordered, mutable collection of items
A sequence of characters enclosed in quotes
A whole number without decimal points
A data type that represents True or False
A file containing Python code that can be imported

content.rules: Match Python terms with their correct definitions. Find all pairs to master the fundamentals!

activities.title: Advanced Data Structures Explorer
activities.description: Explore advanced Python data structures like deque, defaultdict, and Counter.

structures.name: deque (Double-ended queue)
structures.usage:
d = deque([1, 2, 3])
d.appendleft(0)
d.append(4)
print(d)  # deque([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])
structures.complexity: O(1) for append/pop operations at both ends

structures.name: defaultdict
structures.advantages: Automatically creates missing keys with default values
structures.complexity: Same as regular dict, but prevents KeyError

structures.name: Counter
structures.complexity: O(n) for counting, O(1) for access

structures.name: namedtuple
structures.usage:
Point = namedtuple('Point', ['x', 'y'])
p = Point(1, 2)
print(p.x, p.y)  # 1 2
structures.complexity: Memory efficient, faster than regular classes

practiceExercises: Implement a text analyzer using Counter
Build a browser history using deque
